result.execSummary:
The defendant Omar Fraire-Perales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Counts 2 and 3, with credit for 13 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
- Restitution is set at $0.
- The court orders defendant to pay restitution, all costs, fees, assessments, and surchargesduring the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Seek and maintain full time employment or verify school enrollment.

- No law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No contact with the victim unless approved by the Department and with parents consent.
- Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.
- Cooperate with the Department and any treatment deemed appropriate.

House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Omar Fraire-Perales

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Omar Fraire-Perales
Current: 1136 W. Madison St., Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2022)
Prior: 10009 West Appleton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $875.00 entered as ordered by the court on 08-17-2022  to pay $50.00/monthly.  Final payment due by 03-01-2024. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:     LORI KUEHN   $875.00
Affidavit and Order or Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs, Signed and Filed.  mn

Defendant Omar Fraire-Perales in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter for the victims: Natalia Fajardo.

Amended information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY to COUNTS 1, 2, and 3 of the Amended Information.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Amended information as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, Parents of the victim EP and JFA, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to COUNTS 2 and 3, with credit for 13 DAYS time served. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to COUNTS 1 and 3, with credit for 0 DAYS time served. 

AS TO COUNT 3:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to COUNTS 1 and 2, with credit for 0 DAYS time served. 

Court STAYED the sentences and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS AS TO ALL COUNTS:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
No law violations rising to the level of probable cause
Cooperate with the Department and any treatment deemed appropriate
Seek and maintain full time employment or verify school enrollment
No contact with the victim unless approved by the Department and with parents consent.
Complete 75 hours of community service.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Restitution is set at $0.
The court orders defendant to pay restitution, all costs, fees, assessments, and surchargesduring the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Defendant Omar Fraire-Perales in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea and sentencing July 7, 2022, 9am room 502SB.  kmw
JPS report

Defendant Omar Fraire-Perales in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Pittman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court advise defendant all condition remain the same for Justice Point and No Contact Order. Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JPS report
Preliminary hearing on May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kuehn has been appointed by the Court in this matter. The next date was selected in her absence and does not work for her calendar. Next court date of 4/26/2022 at 8:30am is changed to 5/11/2022 at 8:30am. Parties are notified.

Defendant Omar Fraire-Perales in court.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Omar Fraire-Perales appeared by video means.  Defendant appears without counsel.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed attorney Lori Kuehn, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month, commencing 30 days subsequent to finding of guilt or innocence, beginning the 1st day of every month until all fees and expenses are paid.  Court advised defendant that failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case is adjourned.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JPS report
Indigency hearing on April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Omar Fraire-Perales in court by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $3,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.

Pretrial Order, signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JFP

DAR UNAVAILABLE DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES.  CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defendant Omar Fraire-Perales in court with attorney Thomas R. Reed.  Defendant Omar Fraire-Perales in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Omar Fraire-Perales appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
